intro: Nuttallia rusbyi, commonly known as the Rusby's nuttallia, is a species of flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Nuttallia rusbyi is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats.
